bibl.title: A King of Makuria in Kordofan.
bibl.note: All the attestations of King Sit's reign show that Makuria / Dotawo was not a petty state torn apart by internal and external conflicts; quite the contrary, it appears as a kingdom that was able to retain control over a vast territory.

bibl.title: Nubian Voices. Studies in Christian Nubian Culture

bibl.seg: Grzegorz Ochała, A King of Makuria in Kordofan.

Adam Łajtar & Jacques van der Vliet (edd.), with the assistance of Grzegorz Ochała & Giovanni Ruffini, Nubian Voices. Studies in Christian Nubian Culture = The Journal of Juristic Papyrology. Supplements. Volume XV (Warsaw, 2011) pp. 149-155, 1 fig.

All the attestations of King Sit's reign show that Makuria / Dotawo was not a petty state torn apart by internal and external conflicts; quite the contrary, it appears as a kingdom that was able to retain control over a vast territory.
